text: Common Java technologies that actually modify .class files and their drawbacks?
At first I was a bit shocked when reading this part from the JiBX doc:
Having a tool modifying .class files seemed at first quite weird then I noticed that JiBX actually has quite some advantages (including speed) and I was wondering...
What are common technologies/framework/APIs used in the Java world that do actually need to modify .class files and what are their drawbacks?

To me it complicates unit testing and it can also complicate stack trace reading but I may be mistaken (well, at least for obsfuscators I'm not mistaken: they do complicate stack trace reading which is more or less one of the main point of such a tool in the first place ; )
(I realize obsfuscators/code-scramblers like Proguard do actually modify .class file, but that is for an obvious reason).
